questions.question: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for end-to-end communication?
What is the main difference between Layer 2 and Layer 3 networking?
choices: Layer 2 uses MAC addresses, while Layer 3 uses IP addresses
Layer 2 is for wired networks, while Layer 3 is for wireless networks
Layer 2 is for LAN communication, while Layer 3 is for WAN communication
Layer 2 is for switching, while Layer 3 is for routing
questions.answer: Layer 2 uses MAC addresses, while Layer 3 uses IP addresses

questions.question: What is the purpose of a VLAN?
choices: To logically separate devices on a switch
To convert IP addresses to MAC addresses
questions.answer: To logically separate devices on a switch

questions.question: Which command is used to view and configure network interfaces in Linux?
What is the purpose of subnetting?
choices: To divide a network into smaller subnetworks
To convert MAC addresses to IP addresses
questions.answer: To divide a network into smaller subnetworks

questions.question: Which protocol is used to map IP addresses to MAC addresses?
What is the purpose of the DHCP protocol?
choices: To dynamically assign IP addresses to devices
To convert domain names to IP addresses
questions.answer: To dynamically assign IP addresses to devices
